Primal bandersnatches are among the most powerful of their kind, due to their ties to the [First World](/Planes.aspx?ID=10). **[Recall Knowledge - Beast](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2), [Nature](/Skills.aspx?ID=10)): DC 39 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 37 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 34 [Primal Bandersnatch](/Monsters.aspx?ID=2205) **Source** [Kingmaker Adventure Path](/Sources.aspx?ID=150) pg. 610 **Perception** +33; [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12), [scent](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=33) (precise) 120 feet **Languages** **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +33, [Athletics](/Skills.aspx?ID=3) +37, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +36, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +36, [Survival](/Skills.aspx?ID=16) +31 **Str** +10 **Dex** +6 **Con** +6 **Int** -4 **Wis** +6 **Cha** +6 --- **AC** 44 **Fort** +35 **Ref** +33 **Will** +31 +1 status to all saves vs. [magic](/Traits.aspx?ID=103) **HP** 395 ([fast healing 15](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=15)) **Immunities** [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=5) **Planar Acclimation** The bandersnatch treats the plane it is on as its home plane.
**Confusing Gaze** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) 30 feet. When a creature ends its turn in the aura, it must succeed at a DC 38 Will save or become [confused](/Conditions.aspx?ID=5) for 1 round.
**Quick Recovery** The bandersnatch recovers with frightening speed. At the end of its turn, it reduces the value of one debilitating condition it suffers (with the exception of [dying](/Conditions.aspx?ID=11)) by 1. If it's [blinded](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1), [dazzled](/Conditions.aspx?ID=7), [deafened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=8), [fatigued](/Conditions.aspx?ID=15), [fleeing](/Conditions.aspx?ID=17), or [petrified](/Conditions.aspx?ID=30), it can instead succeed at a DC 16 flat check to end one of these conditions of its choice; it can't use quick recovery on other conditions that lack values.
**[Attack of Opportunity](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=3)** Tail only. --- **Speed** 50 feet, climb 20 feet **Melee** jaws +37 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d12+18 piercing **Melee** claw +37 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d8+18 slashing **Melee** tail +37 ([deadly d12](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 20 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)), **Damage** 4d4+18 piercing plus pain **Ranged** quill +33 ([range increment 100 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=248)), **Damage** 4d4+18 piercing plus pain **Focus Gaze** ([Emotion](/Traits.aspx?ID=60), [Enchantment](/Traits.aspx?ID=61), [Mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106), [Primal](/Traits.aspx?ID=134)) The bandersnatch fixes its gaze at a creature it can see within 30 feet. The target must immediately attempt a Will save against the bandersnatch's confusing gaze. After attempting the save, the creature is temporarily immune to a bandersnatch's Confusing Gaze gaze until the start of the bandersnatch's next turn. **Frumious Charge** The bandersnatch Strides, ignoring difficult terrain, then makes two claw Strikes at the end of its movement. **Lash Out** At the start of its turn, the bandersnatch gains an additional reaction that can be used only to attempt an Attack of Opportunity. **Pain** A bandersnatch's quills create exceptionally painful wounds. The wounded creature must succeed at a DC 41 Fortitude save to resist becoming [drained 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=10) (drained 2 on a critical failure) by this pain. Further bandersnatch Strikes that cause pain increase the amount of drain by 1 for each failed save to a maximum of drained 4. **Relentless Tracker** The bandersnatch can [Track](/Actions.aspx?ID=66) while moving at its full speed.
Other Bandersnatches **Warning - this sidebar contains spoilers for the Kingmaker adventure path.** The bandersnatch presented here is a creature that retains its ties to the [First World](/Planes.aspx?ID=10), known to some scholars as primal bandersnatches. Bandersnatches who have dwelt on the [Material Plane](/Planes.aspx?ID=1) for longer periods can be less dangerous, although it's unheard of for a bandersnatch to weaken below 13th level. Just as surely, even more powerful bandersnatches lie in wait in the deepest reaches of the First World.
